name: Greek Salmon & Beans
preparation: Trim ends from beans and discard. Place beans and tomatoes in Multipurpose Steamer. Grind salt and pepper on top, if desired. Cover and microwave on high until tender-crisp, 3–4 min.
Cut salmon into four pieces. Arrange over veggies; sprinkle with dip mix.
Cover and microwave on high until  beans are tender and fish is cooked through, about 4 min.
Using the 2-in-1 Citrus Press, squeeze  in juice from lemon.
tips: Swap fish for pieces of boneless, skinless chicken.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with 1 cup rice or mashed sweet potatoes  and 1 tbsp prepared Lemon Dilly Dip.

products.name: Lemon Dilly Dip Mix
summary: Beyond being one of our most-loved kid-friendly dips – they love it for dunking chicken strips, fish bites, and veggies – Lemon Dilly is all about versatility. With loads of dill and a hint of lemon zest, it makes an utterly delicious tzatziki and spread for burgers and sandwiches, and levels up everything from salad dressing and salmon to pasta and vegetables.

products.name: Multipurpose Steamer
summary: Like a casserole dish in design & purpose, this cooking utensil is made of silicone & has a 14-cup capacity.
